name: Carlton Hotel, Autograph Collection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good, 4-star hotel. Central location in midtown Manhattan, two blocks from Empire State building, one block from Fifth Avenue.
reviews.title: Classy Hotel, Central location
Nice, but not as nice as it looks.
reviews.text: We had a king room. Good size with usual amenities although bathroom small.

reviews.title: hotel was lovely but not a great location
reviews.text: Hotel has a small business centre for internet access (small charge made) plus an ATM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would happily go back there.
reviews.title: Perfectly fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a trip for my girlfriend and I for Valentines. As I looked for hotels, i was not able to find any in several price ranges. First I looked for under $100, and found nothing, so I looked for hotels under $200, and still no luck. So I decided to look in a price range that I never thought I could afford. I looked at $300 and under and all of a sudden all of the hotels in New York came up. The price on the hotel website for The Carlton on Madison, was listed at something crazy like $450. Anyone that is willing to pay that much for a hotel, and especially this hotel is [--] Crazy. So I was quoted the price of $212 for supposedly a superior room. Well if this was superior, I sure would not want to see the regular room. We checked in and went up to the room and the door hit the bed as we entered. Not ok! So we went back down, and asked to a superior room, they said it was, and gave us one with a slightly different floor plan. This time the door didn't hit the bet as we entered. However, the size was still much smaller than any of the pics on the website. The lobby was beautiful, the location was perfect, and the overall appeal of the hotel was great. The rooms were small, the view was pretty lame, and the pictures were decieving. IF I had paid the price that the hotel website was asking, I would have raised hell. But knowing the price of hotels in NY and that it was Valentines weekend, I was pretty satisfied with the place. NO problems to speak of other than the size. The staff was very friendly, the hotel and the rooms were very clean. The bathroom was large and clean and the location on Madison was very central and in a clean and nice area. Close to Subway stops and in an overall great location. Just blocks away from the Empire State building. So go for it, Get a good deal, and try it out. If you dont expect a huge room, you will get exactly what you want. Hope this has been helpful. Enjoy New York Folks!
reviews.title: nice place and pet friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in early September to see NY for the first time. Really good location right in the centre of Manhattan. Grand Central Station easily walkable if required, and many good delis and eateries locally. Perhaps the staff could be trained to smile a little more, but no problems. The room was excellent and not a bad size, with power shower and big TV (this automatically defaults to paid-for channels when turned on, but press the * key to get news and local stations free). Comfortable bed and good air-con.
reviews.title: Excellent location for sightseeing and transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From JFK get the shuttle bus door-to door for $20, and return by the airport bus near Grand Central Station for $15. Both much cheaper than the set-price taxi fare of $45 plus.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel and ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I went to New York for the first time to celebrate her 60th birthday and choice of hotel was important. The Carlton ticked all the boxes and did not let us down. Clean, great location, friendly staff and value for money. Not being great walkers location was important to us and we were only 4 blocks from the excellent Empire State Building and the lovely Madison Square Park. We would recommend this hotel to those who want that little bit extra when you get that little bit older and perhaps wiser.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lobby. Everything downhill from there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a week of hotel jumping in NYC, The Carlton was my last stop. Having had great luck with the other 2 hotels I stayed at during the week, I was looking forward to this joint given it's fairly positive reviews on-line. Maybe I'd been spoiled by great service elsewhere, but this was a total letdown.
reviews.title: A Great Place for Couples
An excellent hotel
reviews.text: The lobby is lovely, although somewhere creepily quiet. There were folks sitting on the couches, but no one was saying a word. A bit strange. After an awkward walk with my luggage down about 10 stairs to get to reception, I was greeted by a very surly gentleman. Check-in was smooth, although it was the first time I got the cold shoulder for purchasing through Hotwire. There was some obvious animosity from the front desk that I was not a full price client.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Walking in, I was stunned by how beautiful the hotel lobby is. Art deco, I think. Made me want to find a reason to hang out. The hotel bar was convenient. The restaurant not so great. The ambiance was nice. The room was spacious. I didn't expect much of a view, but my windows showed a nice street in this district. I think I'm close to the Flatiron district. There's not much to walk to at night for food or entertainment. But, it's a nice location for business reasons with some flair.
reviews.title: An absolutely gorgeous property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and I had stayed for 5 days 4 nights. Our flight was delayed and did not check in until after midnight. The front desk agent Luc checked us in and he was such an amazing character. He was outgoing, nice, and we made small talk. Luc really knew how to approach a guest, and he was a very approachable person as well. He made a good impression how friendly the staff were. Our bellman Carlos assisted us with the luggage. He was nice and very helpful.
reviews.title: Average at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I guess when I read about this hotel was renovated in 2008, I thought the furniture would be replaced, but the basic standard room, less than 300sqft was a bit outdated from the pictures it showed. The furniture was a bit old, the bathroom windows had cobwebs on it (noticed it on the first night, but it looks like it was cleaned the next day.) The curtains had some stains, and even though there was no view, it wasn't pleasant to open the drapes, because the windows were not very clean. Overall, the washroom, and bed were clean. High speed internet worked really well. I was a bit surprised that they didn't have a coffee machine or water kettle in the room. This should be considered a basic necessity. There was complimentary coffee and tea located in the business center, but not always convenient if I was in pajamas or bed-hair. Also, dental kits are complimentary, but they were out of stock........
reviews.title: Very pretty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They were located downtown east side, believe to be close to midtown. They were extremely close to the #6 subway line (green) stop was on 28th street, or 33rd street works too. A 24 hr Duane Reade is available about a block away. Korea town is also close by and restaurant opens late too. Fast food like McDonalds and Wendy's is available close by if you want to grab something cheap and familiar.
reviews.title: Not Your Cookie Cutter Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did notice that the rooms were sound proof and that was a plus, because my sister and I would come back to the hotel really late and we would not sleep until 3-4am and no guests were disturbed from us talking, having the television on or using the blow-dryer at that time. Their beds are quite comfy and we slept like a baby. The staff was really pleasant, from the front desk to housekeeping, they acknowledge that you are a guest and would greet you at all times. Very friendly. Overall, I enjoy it as a place to sleep, but not exactly to spend too much of my time inside the hotel.
reviews.title: Had a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is spectacular as are the rooms. The hallways are light and airy. The rooms are large by NYC standards. We ordered ice and it arrived faster than I have ever experienced. Very impressive.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, beautiful lobby, terrific service and a lovely bar (with music in a Friday night) made our overnight stay at the Carlton a delight.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being Marriott Gold and celebrating our anniversary we were upgraded to a fabulous suite.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Nice Comfortable Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable and I loved the bath gel (which many hotels no longer give to guests)
reviews.title: Nice place, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Another unusual and welcome addition was a pool table off the bar area.
reviews.title: AMAZING suite, meh rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: e went for a week holidays in Carlton hotel .It was a suggestion by our travel agent. The hotel is in a central but not crowded location . Subway is in a short distance ( about 300 m). There is a very nice "slow fast food" named Essen in a distance of 100 m far where we ate our breakfast as well as nice salads and sushi in reasonable prices. Our room was a standard with a double bed , small but cozy and with a comfortable mattress and good-like furniture. A small room (closet) was opossite the bed and a large flat tv were nice for our accomodation .Our room had a nice view in a small park behind the building,but I suppose that many rooms do not have a view but only walls very close to windows..Personell was very friendly and a guy was present in a special position for giving informations about the city. Good aircontitioning - no noise - vey clean - nice bathroom .And at last : we asked about the ways to go to JFK for our return flight .They suggested not to take a taxi , but to call a car with a driver and that would be cheaper and better. We thought that this would be a car in an official relation with the hotel , but we surprised because the final price was 70 dollars (taxi about 57).
reviews.title: CENTRAL LOCATION , EXCELLENT SERVICE, COZY ROOMS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here recently for work and found the hotel to meet my needs, but it didn't blow me away. The hotel itself is a very pretty hotel with lots of charm, combining historical characters of the hotel with modern charm.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel for Work Trip
Repeat stay
reviews.text: This hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Penn station. I arrived on a Sunday afternoon, right after a long holiday weekend. The taxi line was HUGE, so my colleague and I decided to just walk (in 95* heat - yikes!). The walk was easy and not too bad. I'm not sure I'd consider this hotel if I were to return for pleasure because it didn't seem like it was in the middle of the action.

reviews.title: Highly recommend - great rooms, service and food
reviews.text: When checking in, I was promptly greeted and given my key. I was with a colleague, so fortunately the person checking her in told us where everything was, as the girl I dealt with seemed to have no interest in her job. She handed me my key and said I was in room 820. No guidance on where the elevators were, no information on the hotel... nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was decent. By New York City standards, it was a decent size, but compare it to any other city in the US, and this room would be small. The bathroom was a decent size, but had an awkward layout to use the toilet. The lighting could have been better too. Most importantly though, the rooms were clean. I will say, it is obvious the building is older, as it clearly hasn't been soundproofed. I could hear quite a bit in the hallways and outside at night. If you're sensitive to noise, bring earplugs.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd like to spend every Christmas in NYC with my boyfriend, and a ton of friends. My family lives everywhere but close, so when the holidays roll around, and folks are rebuilding family ties, I try to squeeze every bit out of the extra days off. So many places shut down, but in NYC things are hopping!
reviews.title: Christmas in New York forever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: And with the TINY slowdown during Xmas, hotels, including the Carlton offer better rates. So we jumped (thanks to TravelZoo) and wanted to be close enough to the theatres, Greenwich Village, SoHo and generally mid/downtown. With renovations the place looked very proper, elegant, heavy, with shadows in the right places. It's more a hotel for biz execs but we were there for fun. We couldn't t believe they let us in the hotel, frankly. Go figure.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay!

likes.liked: — the beds, housekeeping was extra fast, the lobby
likes.disliked: — our room location, about 2 feet across the elevators

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I LOVE NYC. It is a foodie festival every day. A safari for gourmets. The hotel on this occasion had to take second consideration. But about the hotel. It is in a quieter section, but cabs were easy to get. The look and feel is heavier, older, stately but with clean lines. The rooms are decently sized for NY, with a slight floral style. The bed was NOT comfortable; the shower, absolutely glorious. What really hurt the hotel was its out of control heating. It was so hot that even when we left the window open in December and turned on the air con, it still felt stuffy. WEIRD. Room service is good, and there's a wonderful little diner the next block over. The hotel restaurant, Country, is pricey but their "oeuf au plat" for breakfast/brunch incredibly rich, and perfect for those pushing the envelope on their cholesterol levels.
reviews.title: Overpriced, room small by any std.,non-functional HVAC & management didn't care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So it was a beautiful, perfectly efficient hotel. Although I have great memories of the weekend, I would be hard put to recommend strongly the hotel to friends for (1) fun factor, (2) value, (3) charm. Also, aside from the little diner one block down and a 24/7 convenience store one block up, no quick quick outstanding eateries were 2 minutes away. Certainly, that's nothing the hotel can control... but those are the things that count for me! I can go on and on about the heating problems and shower... but would you want me to?
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because of a great deal we got for the room at half off the rack rates for a 2 double beds room. It was worth the money we paid especially during this time of the year.
reviews.title: Will Definitely Return Next Trip to New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: New York is usually a hit or miss with these hotels. I just stayed here 1 night and liked the hotel. Stayed in an executive room with a king sized bed. Good tv, bathroom is a bit small and uncomfortable. Shower heads could be better so we can get a bit more flow. Molton Brown shampoo and wash is a big plus!! Good job there.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is nearby a citibike rental (1 block on 5th av) which was awesome to move around!
reviews.title: beautiful hotel in a great location
Nothing special but a nice place where to stay
reviews.text: Overall good hotel. Reception looks nice and service though I did not use it as much looks pretty good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Historic boutique hotel that has been updated nicely. Room was large, beautiful and comfortable. Loved the location near Chelsea, MSG/Penn Station and the Flat Iron District. Very good coffee in the business center.
reviews.title: Stylish and clean with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Been here for a week and I was not particularly impressed by the hotel.
reviews.title: Great reception, fantastic location, gym is great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a superior room online though a discout travel site and was upgraded to the slightly larger deluxe. I'm really glad we had the upgrade, because the room was not particularly large. It was a good size though with plenty of room for the queen bed and a desk. The room itself was nicely decorated. I loved the large flat-screen tv. The bathroom was ample size with tub/shower and large sink/vanity. The location was nothing spectacular, but it was definitaly convenient for getting to most parts of the city. Subway was just a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Liked the Carlton - a fairly good value for NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The photos we saw of this hotel didn´t do it justice. Though the rooms are not large, they are stylish, clean, cosy, and beautifully designed. The lobby was grand and atmospheric. The bathroom was beautiful with luxurious bath products. The bed was extremely comfortable. The location was right in the middle of Manhatten not far from the Chrysler, Empire State and Flatiron buildings, and conveniently next to a metro station on 28th.
reviews.title: Beautifully stylish hotel (just a pity about the staff)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We might have rated this hotel 5 stars if it wasn´t for the fact that the staff were not warm, helpful or professional. Reception staff were fairly efficient but not friendly, and upon check-out three of the staff stood right in front of us in the middle of the reception desk, chatting loudly about getting their teeth whitened!! On arrival nobody offered to take our bags up to our room, and on departure a doorman carried our cases just three metres up five steps inside the lobby, and not even outside the hotel to the waiting taxi, and then stood around waiting for the tip! Once the chambermaid forget to put any towels in the bathroom - no problem - but when I called down to reception to request some, again the response was very cold.
reviews.title: Attractive choice in this part of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you´re paying a reasonable price to stay at this hotel, we would very highly recommend. We got an excellent deal on a travel website and were extremely happy with the result. But for it to really contend in the highest league of luxury New York hotels, they need to have much better service and staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to go to New York for our 11th anniversary. We usually go to NYC at least once a year anyway (our last visit was March of '09, before that June of '08). First time staying at this hotel though--we usually stay downtown. Booked through Hotwire as I almost always do. After learning which hotel we would be staying at, I came to TripAdvisor to read reviews and was concerned by some of the things said by others about customer service. Decided to just get there and see how things went.
reviews.title: What a great surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very disappointed with my recent stay at the Carlton on Madision in New York.
reviews.title: Disappointed in The Carlton on Madision Ave.-read this before you stay there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: To start, it is NOT as nice as it looks online!! My husband and I arrived to find out that they did not have the original room that we had booked, so we had to take a room with two double beds. It was so small that the door hit the bathroom when we entered. We were able to switch the next night to a queen size bed, not much better. still very small, barely enough room for our two suitcases. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. The towel racks were falling off the wall in both of the rooms that we had. There was barely any lighting. The first room had a broken lamp and and one of the electrical outlets was hanging off of the wall. Several other guests also told us that they had to switch rooms.To top it off, we had almost $30 worth of honor bar charges when we checked out, even though we had never used the honor bar! As we were waiting to speak to the front desk about it, another gentleman came up with the same problem. I do not know how this place gets away with being rated a 4 star hotel!! I have stayed in plenty of 4 stars and this one was by far the worst! I would rate it a 2 star.
reviews.title: Excellent Location for Central New York
Nice but Underachieves
reviews.text: This was the first time we had been to America and I was not disappointed with the Carlton on Madison Avenue. The hotel was very clean throughout, the staff were very polite, pleasant and very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening and the lady on the desk gave us an upgraded room, which was lovley. The bed was so comfortable with lovely linen and a feather duvet. The bedlinen was changed daily. The room was on the fifth floor and was very quiet, we had no disruptions at all.
reviews.title: 5 Star All the Way Impressive
shame about the staff
reviews.text: There was a tv in the room which was ideally placed and great to watch in bed! There was also a small ironing board and a fab iron!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little worried about this hotel after reading other peoples reviews before arriving . I had nothing to fear. This was a perfect hotel - not impersonal like some of the big chains in horrible brash Times Square! The staff were lovely & the room great although I did ask to be changed from the first room we were given - small for a deluxe & poor view. My request was handled politely and the 2nd room was just what we wanted. My surprise was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but I had read about this before I left England & bought a travel kettle with me & mugs etc. Fresh milk was bought daily from the delicous Cafe 28 - amazing breakfasts and 2 mins walk away.
reviews.title: Great hotel - not too big, friendly & clean - good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This Carlton definitely misses the Ritz as the hotel misses the mark by a mile. Slated as a 4-star hotel, the rooms are small, noisy, with uncomfortable beds and creepy hallways. Definitely not worth the rating, perhaps 3 star is more fitting. The most impressive part of the hotel is the lobby, beyond the entrance there is nothing else that really impresses the customer. From it's poor location, to amateur service, the Carlton is one to avoid.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a lovely hotel - beautiful building and rooms. Clean and comfortable. Great location. No problems with free wifi. Breakfast at Country Restuarant was delicious! Enjoyed the yogurt and granola parfait, french toast. Appreciated a complimentary mini-fridge at our request.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location, some service issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Booked hotel package through a specialty hotel website, package included breakfast vouchers, valet parking, a food/beverage credit. At check-in, room rate was correct but had to ask for breakfast vouchers, parking, food/bev credit. Took a while for a manager to come up to provide the vouchers and explain parking. At check-out, I was charged for parking and food/bev credit was not applied. Had to ask staff to correct bill. Bill was corrected, with apologies. Received an ontime wake-up call the first morning, but second morning the wake-up call was recieved more than 30 mins late. Caller insists she called earlier, at the requested time, but husband and I doubt this (we woke up on time on our own - glad we weren't relying on the wake-up call).
reviews.title: Quiet and efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 18 nights on business. I stayed in an Executive Double room and it was clean, and surprisingly spacious with a really good size bathroom with bath and separate shower.
reviews.title: Highly recommended, great location, price, service and style.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The lobby is lovely, the staff competent. Our room was very small which I expected after reading reviews. You can barely move the desk chair out to sit because the queen size bed takes up most of the room. There was a tear in the carpet and our room safe did not work. We were told we could bring our valuables down to the lobby....no, thanks. The room was very clean and the bedding was luxurious and very comfortable. At check in we asked for a room on a high floor but were told "sorry this is the type of room you booked but it is very nice." Our view was of some industrial stuff on a neighboring roof. So if you booked through Hotwire don't expect an upgrade. All in all it was fine.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location in midtown Manhatten, not too far from 5th Avenue, the Empire State Building, and the theatre district.
reviews.title: relaxing but perhaps a little snooty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a good size, clean and had a nice bathroom with a shower and a bathtub. It was dimly lit, however, with just three bedside lamps and no main light fitting. We couldn't get the safe to work and the air-con was the same temperature nomatter what the setting.
reviews.title: Wonderful four nights at the Carlton

likes.liked: — Overall classiness of the place, extremely comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Upon check in we were given no information about the room or the hotel and throughout the stay felt that the staff thought it an inconvenience to speak to us - having to tear their eyes from the very important box-ticking or whatever business they were conducting on their computer screens at the time which prevented them from acknowledging our presence!
reviews.title: I Love the Carlton

likes.liked: — gorgeous old building and incredibly comfortable beds!
likes.disliked: — not walkably close to tourist attractions, other than the Empire State Building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked our account one night only to realise that we had been charged about $80 worth of honor bar items. The hotel receptionist says this happens all the time (how reassuring)...you are automatically charged to your credit card for any item that is moved from its place so watch out for that.
reviews.title: overwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit NYC a few times a year to see our son, and this is the only hotel we've chosen to stay in more than once. It's attractive, with clean, spacious, well-equipped rooms at a price that's reasonable for New York. We particularly appreciate the bathrooms because they have ample counter space to set out toiletries. Our bath this time even had shelves next to the sink . And the hotel is centrally located only a block from the 28th St. 4,5,6 subway stop, so it's easy to get around the city from here.
reviews.title: We Will Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only criticism on this visit is of the concierge staff. When we first arrived, I asked the man on duty to recommend a restaurant in the immediate neighborhood for a light lunch. He was friendly and tried to be helpful, but he really didn't have a clue. Nor did the woman also on duty at the time. It seems to me well-trained people in this role should have such knowledge at their fingertips. Fortunately, someone standing nearby overheard my request and recommended a liitle cafe only two blocks away--"Naturally Tasty" lived up to its name.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, clean and quiet. Lacks customer service though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here recently for our honeymoon. On arrival we asked if it was possible to upgrade our room as it was our honeymoon, but due to the response of the front desk, we had to quickly learn we were not going to get any special treatment at this hotel! We let that pass. We found the room very clean, the bed extremely comfortable and quiet. Air conditioning worked well as you can't really have the window open because of the constant noise from outside! Bed sheets were changed daily and bathroom shampoos, shower gels replenished although the maid removed any full bottles before our last day! The room had a big TV and a safe and provides you with wireless internet access.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We hoped that we would get on friendly terms with the staff at this hotel but they kept to their selves. One even we asked the concierge if they could book a town car to take us to a Broadway show and they would not. I found this surprising as I thought they would be happy to do that for their guests. The friendliest staff there were the maids and porters who would always say good morning and have a little chat with you.
reviews.title: Adequate, but not spectacular!
beautiful hotel rude and lousy service
reviews.text: Good location as it is very near the Empire State building and Macy's. We did not eat at the hotel but bought food from the many delis situated in this block.

aka: Carlton Hotel, Autograph Collection Hotel New York City
description: A midtown Manhattan luxury boutique hotel located near the Empire State Building, Union Square and other New York City attractions. Offers vacation packages and special offers, as well as meeting and event space.
